meanings.definition: A set of written characters representing syllables.
meanings.sent1: In some languages, syllabaries are used instead of alphabets.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Japanese writing system includes syllabaries.
meanings.sent3: The teacher made learning syllabaries fun by turning it into a game.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was a colorful garden of syllabaries blooming with meaning.
meanings.sent5: The children practiced writing syllabaries on the chalkboard, giggling as they formed each character.

meanings.definition: A system of writing in which each character represents a syllable.
meanings.sent1: The Cherokee syllabaries are unique to their language.
meanings.sent2: Learning syllabaries can be challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The syllabaries danced across the page, telling a story in each character.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a complex web of syllabaries, each thread representing a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The calligrapher carefully crafted each syllabary, infusing it with beauty and meaning.
